alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 21 at 4:28PM AKDT until March 22 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected with visibilities down to a quarter mile or less in blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound, specifically the Seward Highway corridor from Girdwood south to Turnagain Pass and Portage Glacier Road east to Whittier. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 6 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to a quarter of a mile or less. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and afternoon commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are mostly likely between Whittier and the eastern Turnagain Arm, including Turnagain Pass. Rain may mix with snow during the afternoon hours Wednesday at sea level, but the rain/snow line is expected to remain between sea level and 200 ft in elevation through the duration of the event. Snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches expected from Turnagain Pass north and 6 to 12 inches expected from Turnagain Pass south to Seward.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
